Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback.  I have never had such a negative opinion of me and my approach to yoga.  We understand that one of the wonders of yoga is that there are wonderful and different ways to teaching yoga. Obviously my approach is not for you.  We do however have to answer some of your complaints.  Your first complaint was about herbal laxatives.  We do have them available along with other herbs and plants that are helpful during the cleansing process. We do not push them on anyone for weight loss. Just like with any diet, the colon does get backed up and most people find an herbal laxative helpful.    I would like to mention that Katresha, my wife, is always lovely - just not to make up for my abruptness.  The week you were here four of the seven people were returnees.  They loved their week retreat and have since returned again.  One lady did leave on Thursday, completing a five-day retreat (which we also offer) rather than a seven-day retreat.   Concerning our yoga, we are very firm about certain things.  We address these on the very first morning that you are here.  Everyone is different and at The Pearl Laguna, we stress moving the pose to the body, not the body to the pose.  We believe that the perfect pose is where the body goes naturally today, not what is in some yoga book.  To me the strongest pose in yoga is the Madonna gesture. The whole week is built around you standing strongly on your path, arms to the side, palms up facing the front with a fearless, wide, open heart.  Unlike most yoga teachers we understand that most people are hurt in yoga doing forward bends. So we protect the back by insisting that you do not come up or go down with a rounded back.  We understand that if you bend your knees and sit back, keeping a flat back until your belly touches your thighs, then roll forward into the forward bend, it is helpful. When you come out of the forward bend - you bend your knees, sit back, raise your head first so that your back muscles activate and flatten your back and after that you will never hurt your back.  Also, there will be a secondary benefit of strengthening the back, thighs and buns.   We feel that most people injury their shoulders during Chaturanga (or a push up in the gym) because it is not done properly.  Most people should use their knees. Their elbows should be tight to the side of their bodies with their shoulders back and down.   Their chin should be furthest from the ground and they should only drop down to 90 degrees on their arms.  Our yoga is specifically designed to aid our program and to compensate for three hours a day of hiking in the hills.  We do Power Yoga in the AM to wake you up and get things going.  We do gentle yoga at night to bring you down.  Our program is built on positive, loving energy.  If you didn’t feel that, I’m sorry.  Geo

This place is designed to support you on your journey as you explore healthy living choices -- energy boosting exercise (yoga, hiking, pool exercise, gym fitness), nourishing food (superb ovo-lacto-vegan cuisine!!!), and relaxing quiet time (including daily massage!).  Oh, yes, I had the best night(s) sleep of my life while there.  The rooms are luxuriously appointed with fine linens

I did get what i wanted from The Pearl retreat--a good first step for getting healthier. The yoga and hiking were great. The food and teas were delicious--probably about 1200 calories a day. The massages were fantastic. The sauna, hot tub, and salt water pool really good for relaxing sore muscles. We took two trips to the beach during the week--a nice change in the daily schedule.   However, there were a few things that didn't work for me. The weight training after the hikes seemed slapped together. I'm not that familiar with weight machines and we had about 30 minutes to rotate through as many machines as possible. It was a little rushed and chaotic.  There were so many staff members that rotated daily that it was hard to know who was who and who was responsible for what.
Manager Response: As a valued guest we appreciate your honest feedback and would like to address your concerns.  We are pleased to read that you experienced what you wanted from The Pearl Laguna.  Our guests come to us from around the world and locally to experience a rejuvenating week of yoga, hiking and cleansing.  Geo and Katresha, our owners and founders, have created a balanced program that is designed to move our guests through a detoxifying and energizing process.  Our healthy vegetarian cuisine is prepared in the spirit of love.  We are into health, not calories. Our therapeutic and healing massages help our guests rejuvenate after a morning of hiking the hills of beautiful Laguna Canyon. We feel blessed to be located so close to the Pacific Ocean and enjoy taking our guests there for a sunset stroll or evening yoga.  Many of our guests enjoy our weight program, which is offered after the hike to help strengthen and tone the body.  Our gym is available to our guests at any time of the day.  At the Pearl Laguna, we are pleased to say that we have the same staff since opening five years ago with consistent guides, cooks and House Manager.  Some evenings we offer a Fireside Chat to our guests.  Various health topics are discussed.  We offer handouts of all of our topics including organic dressing recipes our guests can make at home.  Katresha’s Pure Skin Care is provided complimentary for our guests use if they wish as part of the cleansing experience.  Katresha’s healing oils are also used during our guest’s massages.  Often our guests request a stop in town at the end of the week, as they may need cash for their trip home.  Our accommodations are twelve lovely and unique private rooms and baths with the exception of two smaller private rooms that share a bath. All of our rooms are designed with love with organic beds, linens and fresh flowers to welcome you.  The Pearl Laguna is a place and program of rejuvenation.  Our guests come to cleanse – renewing their spirit and emerge from their stay stronger, healthier and revitalized.  We wish you Love and Light in your continued journey of health.

Summary: Love-love-love The Pearl Laguna.  Superb program.  Fantastic yoga.  Delicious food.  Wonderful accommodations.  Positive energy. The Pearl Laguna is all that and more.  I didn't want to leave!  Pure and simple: Geo and Katresha are the real deal.  I left feeling healthy, renewed and on a great path.  I'm going back for sure.

I appreciated the attention and guidance from Geo, Katresha and all the staff.  They seemed to know just what I needed at any given time.  On the trails, the guides were always encouraging and intuitive, giving me space to walk on my own (even though they were always close by) when I needed to be alone with my thoughts. This was a fantastic experience and a true transformation.  Health is key and I learned so much.  Geo and Katresha are great yoga teachers, nutrition experts,  warm and guiding hands in a journey to health.  Fantastic hiking, a beautiful setting.  Can't recommend it highly enough.  Just go!

Worth every penny.  It is hard to put into words how wonderful The Pearl Laguna truly is - the people, the location, the experience - all are amazing. Summary Heading: Want to Lose Weight and Have a Fun Holiday?
Summary: Then here is my answer! I recently traveled across the world from Perth, Western Australia and spent an amazing two weeks at the beautiful and peaceful retreat called The Pearl Laguna, Hiking and Yoga Spa. This fabulous spa was founded by Geo and Katresha Moskios, two of the worlds most renowned yoga teachers and also two of the most caring and motivating people you will ever meet. The Pearl Laguna is an intimate retreat nestled amongst trees in the Laguna Canyon and has twelve beautiful bedrooms all with marble bathrooms. Even the New York Times rated this five star Spa the best! Laguna Beach itself is a quaint seaside village full of fabulous art galleries and about an hours drive south of LA and an hour from San Diego. So easily accessible especially from Orange County

I recently spent a wonderful week at The Pearl.  The best reasons to go to there, based on my experience, are that their program works, the setting is aesthetically delightful, and the people who work there are unfailingly helpful as you go through a week of what is essentially diet and rigorous exercise. One of the first things that the staff does is to weigh you and measure you, so that you can really see the results at the end of the week. I lost over 5 pounds and took 1.75 inches off of my waist and 3 inches off of my hips. I also left with a rejuvenated attitude about my health and the next steps in my life. Don't kid yourself, this is a boot camp, but what a boot camp it is. If you buy into the program, you will detox, get in much, much better shape, and lose a shocking amount of weight but do it in a healthy fashion. The Blue Pearl location is both restful and unique in a good way, the hiking trails are staggeringly beautiful, and the climate is the best in the world. Nestled in the canyon of Laguna Beach is a jewel of a find. One part spa/hideaway and one part emotional journey. My husband and I loved the contrast to our experience at the Ashram. No more sharing bathrooms or wishing for the comforts of home. The Blue Pearl has beautiful bedrooms and bathrooms for each client, delectable food, daily massage and daily facial masks. Moreover, not only did we lose the same amount of weight but we enjoyed the process so much more. Sure you hike for up to ten miles after yoga and follow it with weights class all BEFORE lunch but we had afternoons off to relax in the sauna or jacuzzi before massage.   Highly recommend this for newcomers and veterans who have been to the Ashram too.  It was a nice change of pace.

Summary Heading: Retreat from the daily grind to transform yourself through yoga, hiking and a cleanse
Summary: I highly recommend the Blue Pearl Spa to those looking to transform themselves through a rigorous yet enjoyable daily schedule of yoga and hiking through the magnificent canyons as well as a manageable cleanse. Beautiful, inviting accommodations staffed by knowledgeable, positive professionals - from the people preparing the delicious and satisfying meals and snacks to those leading the breathtaking, challenging hikes and the masseurs and masseuses who so expertly knead your muscles after a sauna or a whirlpool -  all support the incredible experience that is the Blue Pearl Spa! FUN - the results will not disappoint!!!

Summary Heading: Amazing place with fantastic hosts and transforming experience
Summary: This is a unique and  special place - filled with positive energy that will transform  you inside and outside.   Beautiful rooms.  The organic, pure, clean food was delicious.   Amazing hikes, good yoga and excellent massages round out the experience.   Each and every person that works there is extra special and radiates warmth and hospitality.  Anyone who has the chance to experience Blue Pearl will be lucky!!!

The food is clean, fresh and highly nutritious. The yoga is achievable and extremely toning. The staff are magical and the weight loss achieved very satisfactory. I left feeling more beautiful inside and out with a new calmness which has lasted. The bedrooms are fab, clean and fresh with tasteful colour schemes and the infa red sauna was a huge bonus along with the hot tub. The hikes are uplifting as well as challenging. Come and stay here if you want to lose weight, improve your skin and radiate health.

Summary Heading: Experience mind and body transformation at Blue Pearl Laguna!
Summary: I was fortunate enough to stumble upon Blue Pearl Laguna while searching the internet for a pre-Christmas destination for my wife and me. I knew only vaguely what I was looking for, but when I read through the website I was sure that the Blue Pearl was it. My wife ultimately could not get the time off work, so I ended up going solo, which turned out to be a great experience. The newly restored facility and grounds are beautiful - every detail is cared for. All of the rooms are lovely - mine had a large bathroom and shower, with a beautiful view of the Laguna wilderness (and no TV, no phone).
